original: 'khor bar rdo rje'i zhags pa yin te rang gi dge ba mthar byed sdig pa lnga po 'di rnams so //
analyzed: 'khor bar rdo rje'i zhags pa yin te rang gi dge ba mthar byed sdig pa lnga po 'di rnams so //
translated: These five sins are the vajra fetters in cyclic existence, which destroy one‚Äôs virtue.

original: cho lo kha na ma tho bcas pa'i zas dang tshig ngan klog dang 'byung po lha min dbang po'i chos //
analyzed: cho lo kha na ma tho bcas pa'i zas dang tshig ngan klog dang 'byung po lha min dbang po'i chos //
translated: Do not play dice, eat forbidden food, read bad books, or practice the religion of the demons and demigods.

original: ba lang byis pa bud med skyes pa rnams dang lha mi'i bla ma gsod pa lnga ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: ba lang byis pa bud med skyes pa rnams dang lha mi'i bla ma gsod pa lnga ni mi bya'o //
translated: Do not kill cows, children, women, men, or the gurus of gods and humans.

original: grogs po rje bo rnams dang lha dang mi yi bla ma dge 'dun yid brtan rnams la 'khu ba spang //
analyzed: grogs po rje bo rnams dang lha dang mi yi bla ma dge 'dun yid brtan rnams la 'khu ba spang //
translated: Do not betray friends, masters, gods, human gurus, or the sa·πÖgha.

original: dbang po rnams ni kun nas chags pa'o zhes pa srid pa'i bdag po'i brtul zhugs rnams ni nyi shu lnga zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po rnams ni kun nas chags pa'o zhes pa srid pa'i bdag po'i brtul zhugs rnams ni nyi shu lnga zhes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe senses are completely attached‚Äù means the observances of the lord of existence are twenty-five.

original: sdig pa can gyi las zhes bya ba bar du gcod par byed pa sta /
analyzed: sdig pa can gyi las zhes bya ba bar du gcod par byed pa sta /
translated: ‚ÄúSinful actions‚Äù are called ‚Äúobstacles.‚Äù

original: mtshams med pa lnga po byed ba rnams kyang nang du bsdus pa'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mtshams med pa lnga po byed ba rnams kyang nang du bsdus pa'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Those who commit the five heinous acts are also included.

original: 'di rnams 'ba' zhig gis lam bzang rin chen 'phrog par ma zad kyi //
analyzed: 'di rnams 'ba' zhig gis lam bzang rin chen 'phrog par ma zad kyi //
translated: Not only do these alone steal the jewel of the good path,üîΩbut also with very much food and drink,

original: shin tu bza' dang btung ba rnams kyis dang // sna tshogs longs spyod rnams kyis kyang ngo //
analyzed: shin tu bza' dang btung ba rnams kyis dang // sna tshogs longs spyod rnams kyis kyang ngo //
translated: and with various enjoyments.

original: bza' ba ni shin tu sha la sogs pa bza' ba'o //
analyzed: bza' ba ni shin tu sha la sogs pa bza' ba'o //
translated: Food is very much meat and so forth to eat.

original: btung ba ni chang 'thung ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: btung ba ni chang 'thung ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Drink is alcohol to drink and so forth.

original: shin tu ni brgyal ba'i chos kyis so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu ni brgyal ba'i chos kyis so zhes pa'o //
translated: Very much is by the nature of fainting.

original: longs spyod par bya bas na longs spyod de phreng ba dang tsandan dang bud med dang mal stan la sogs pa sna tshogs pa bkra ba'o //
analyzed: longs spyod par bya bas na longs spyod de phreng ba dang tsandan dang bud med dang mal stan la sogs pa sna tshogs pa bkra ba'o //
translated: Enjoyment is that which is enjoyed, such as garlands, sandalwood, women, bedding, and so forth, which are various and colorful.

original: brtson 'grus ldan pa la yang ste lam bsgom pa la spro ba'i'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ldan pa la yang ste lam bsgom pa la spro ba'i'o //
translated: Also for those who are diligent, who are enthusiastic about cultivating the path.

original: brjod ma thag pa'i brtson 'grus brtan pa 'ba' zhig gir ma zad kyi brtson 'grus dang ldan pa'i yang ngo zhes pa yang gi sgra'i don to //
analyzed: brjod ma thag pa'i brtson 'grus brtan pa 'ba' zhig gir ma zad kyi brtson 'grus dang ldan pa'i yang ngo zhes pa yang gi sgra'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the word also is not only for those with firm diligence as just mentioned, but also for those who are diligent.

original: bag med pa ni shin tu bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa dang mi dge ba'i grogs po dang 'grogs pa'o //
analyzed: bag med pa ni shin tu bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa dang mi dge ba'i grogs po dang 'grogs pa'o //
translated: Carelessness is the excessive consumption of food, drink, etc., and the association with non-virtuous friends.

original: de'i phyir brgyal ba ste sems med pa nyid du gyur pa la 'phrog par byed pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir brgyal ba ste sems med pa nyid du gyur pa la 'phrog par byed pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, it is precisely the stealing of the unconsciousness, i.e., the absence of mind.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i srid pa'i longs spyod la mngon par dga' ba ni dge ba byed pa rnams kyi yang bar du gcod par byed par brjod ces pa'o //üîΩ'o na de ltar lam rin po che yongs su rtog pa po la mngon par dgongs nas bar du gcod @57a * //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i srid pa'i longs spyod la mngon par dga' ba ni dge ba byed pa rnams kyi yang bar du gcod par byed par brjod ces pa'o // 'o na de ltar lam rin po che yongs su rtog pa po la mngon par dgongs nas bar du gcod @57a * //
translated: The delight in the various enjoyments of existence is said to be an obstruction for those who are virtuous.

original: par byed pa'i skyon rnams brjod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: par byed pa'i skyon rnams brjod pa ma yin nam /
translated: Well, in this way, having considered the one who is fully investigating the precious path, are the faults of the obstructions not described?

original: lam thob pa rang nyid yongs su rtog pa po ma yin pa la brjod pa ci zhig ce na gsungs pa rang nyid ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lam thob pa rang nyid yongs su rtog pa po ma yin pa la brjod pa ci zhig ce na gsungs pa rang nyid ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: But, the one who has attained the path is not the one who is fully investigating himself, so what is the point of the description? It is said:üîΩhimself and so forth.

original: ci ste gang gi phyir rang nyid yongs su rtog pa po min pa gang de'i phyir gzhan cig shos g-yon can khram pa chen po la ston te rang nyid yongs su rtog pa po min pas /
analyzed: ci ste gang gi phyir rang nyid yongs su rtog pa po min pa gang de'i phyir gzhan cig shos g-yon can khram pa chen po la ston te rang nyid yongs su rtog pa po min pas /
translated: But if it is not the one who is himself the examiner, then for the sake of the other, the swindler, he shows the great deception, since he himself is not the examiner.

original: rin thang chen por 'gyur ba shes ched du //
analyzed: rin thang chen por 'gyur ba shes ched du //
translated: For the sake of knowing whether it is of great value,

original: g-yon can gzhan la ston te min zhes pa'i //
analyzed: g-yon can gzhan la ston te min zhes pa'i //
translated: he shows it to another swindler, saying, ‚ÄúIt is not.‚Äù

original: de yi tshig la rin chen 'dor bar byed //
analyzed: de yi tshig la rin chen 'dor bar byed //
translated: From his words, they conclude that it is a jewel.

original: rin thang chen par 'gyur ba ste rin po che chen po yin nam zhes shes par bya ba'i ched du'o //üîΩdes smras pa /
analyzed: rin thang chen par 'gyur ba ste rin po che chen po yin nam zhes shes par bya ba'i ched du'o // des smras pa /
translated: For the sake of knowing whether it is of great value, whether it is a great jewel.

original: mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúNo.‚Äù

original: de nas de'i tshig las te g-yon can gyi dag las 'dor bar byed pa kho na'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de nas de'i tshig las te g-yon can gyi dag las 'dor bar byed pa kho na'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Then from his words, from the words of the swindler, they conclude that it is a jewel.

original: de bzhin kho nar shes rab 'chal pa'i rigs can ni sdig pa'i grogs po'i ngag las lam bzang rin thang med pa'i rin po che thob pa yang gtong bar byed do zhes pa lam rin po che yongs su rtog pa don du gnyer ba rnams kyi yang sdig
analyzed: de bzhin kho nar shes rab 'chal pa'i rigs can ni sdig pa'i grogs po'i ngag las lam bzang rin thang med pa'i rin po che thob pa yang gtong bar byed do zhes pa lam rin po che yongs su rtog pa don du gnyer ba rnams kyi yang sdig
translated: Likewise, those who are of a class with faulty wisdom give up the priceless jewel of the good path, which they have obtained from the words of a sinful friend.

original: pa'i grogs po dang nye bar 'grogs pa'i skyon brjod do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i grogs po dang nye bar 'grogs pa'i skyon brjod do zhes pa'o //
translated: This is the statement of the fault of associating with a sinful friend for those who seek the precious path.üîΩWell then, if the precious path is to be understood in this way, since one is not oneself the investigator, who is?

original: 'o na de ltar lam rin po che rnam par shes par bya na rang nyid yongs su rtog pa po ma yin pas ni gang gi zhe na bden mod de ni gal te gang rnams kyis skabs las rin po che chen po yongs su rtog par byed du
analyzed: 'o na de ltar lam rin po che rnam par shes par bya na rang nyid yongs su rtog pa po ma yin pas ni gang gi zhe na bden mod de ni gal te gang rnams kyis skabs las rin po che chen po yongs su rtog par byed du
translated: This is true, but if some are caused to investigate the great jewel of the path,

original: gzhug pa de rnams kyi ni rnam dag ngag gis te mi slu ba'i tshig gis ci ste gsal bar rnam bar shes par bya ste rin thang med pa rin po che 'di'o zhes nges par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhug pa de rnams kyi ni rnam dag ngag gis te mi slu ba'i tshig gis ci ste gsal bar rnam bar shes par bya ste rin thang med pa rin po che 'di'o zhes nges par bya'o //
translated: then it is to be understood clearly by them with pure speech, with non-deceptive words. This is the priceless jewel.

original: de lta kho nar rigs kyi bus lam rin po che thob pa dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi tshig las 'di ni rin thang med pa'o zhes legs par yongs su brtag pa shin tu brtan par byas nas lhag par rjes su 'brel bar bya /
analyzed: de lta kho nar rigs kyi bus lam rin po che thob pa dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi tshig las 'di ni rin thang med pa'o zhes legs par yongs su brtag pa shin tu brtan par byas nas lhag par rjes su 'brel bar bya /
translated: In this way, the son of good lineage, having well examined the path jewel obtained from the words of the spiritual master, and having made it very firm, should be especially connected with it.üîΩIt should not be abandoned.üîΩThus, the spiritual master is always well explained for the sake of virtue and goodness.

original: dor bar mi bya'o zhes dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa ni rtag tu dge legs kyi ched du legs par bshad de lam rin bo che bsgom pa la brtson pa rnams kyi yang ngo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dor bar mi bya'o zhes dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa ni rtag tu dge legs kyi ched du legs par bshad de lam rin bo che bsgom pa la brtson pa rnams kyi yang ngo zhes pa'o //
translated: Those who are diligent in cultivating the path jewel should also do so.

original: de ltar lam bsgom pa la rab tu zhugs pa'i yang bdud kyi las rnam par spangs pa med par sems brtan par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes pa de'i phyir de kho na ston pa gsungs pa bdud ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar lam bsgom pa la rab tu zhugs pa'i yang bdud kyi las rnam par spangs pa med par sems brtan par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes pa de'i phyir de kho na ston pa gsungs pa bdud ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Thus, even for one who has entered the cultivation of the path, if the activities of Mara are not abandoned, the mind will not become firm. Therefore, in order to teach just that, he says Mara and so on.

original: bdud sdig can ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i @57b sangs rgyas rnams kyi gzugs rnams su sprul nas lam bsgom pa la rab tu zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i bgegs te bar du gcod par byed de /
analyzed: bdud sdig can ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i @57b sangs rgyas rnams kyi gzugs rnams su sprul nas lam bsgom pa la rab tu zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i bgegs te bar du gcod par byed de /
translated: The evil Mara is an obstacle, an obstruction, to the Bodhisattva who is engaged in cultivating the path, by conjuring up the forms of the Perfectly Awakened Ones.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: 'di ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi ched du ba'i lam ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi ched du ba'i lam ma yin la /
translated: This is not the path for the sake of the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: gang gis khyod gnas pa'i lam 'dis 'ga' zhig kyang nges par 'byung ba dang nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang nges par 'byung ba yang ma yin no zhes pa la sogs pa rig par bya ste rgyas par 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i
analyzed: gang gis khyod gnas pa'i lam 'dis 'ga' zhig kyang nges par 'byung ba dang nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang nges par 'byung ba yang ma yin no zhes pa la sogs pa rig par bya ste rgyas par 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i
translated: By this path on which you abide, no one has ever gone forth, is going forth, or will go forth.üîΩAnd so on. This should be understood in detail from the chapter on the deeds of Mara in the noble Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines.

original: bdud kyi las kyi le'ur gsungs pa las shes par bya'o zhes pas bdud kyi las kyi skyon nye bar spangs nas thams cad nye bar bsdu ba gsungs pa de'i phyir zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdud kyi las kyi le'ur gsungs pa las shes par bya'o zhes pas bdud kyi las kyi skyon nye bar spangs nas thams cad nye bar bsdu ba gsungs pa de'i phyir zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Having thus stated the faults of the deeds of Mara, in order to completely eliminate them, he says, ‚ÄúTherefore, etc.‚Äù

original: ci ste gang gi phyir lam 'phrog pa'i rgyu mtshan 'di yod pa de'i phyir te rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci ste gang gi phyir lam 'phrog pa'i rgyu mtshan 'di yod pa de'i phyir te rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: If one asks, ‚ÄúWhy is this the reason for stealing the path? ‚Äù it is because of the cause.

original: chom rkun rtsa lag ces pa nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: chom rkun rtsa lag ces pa nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúBandits‚Äù is a metaphor.

original: the tshom la sogs pa yang yongs su btang byas te 'bad pas te gus pa chen po bla ma dam pas byin pa'i lam bzang rin chen khyad par du 'phags pas legs par spa ba rab tu gsal ba ma yin par slob ma rnams kyis bya'o zhes pa
analyzed: the tshom la sogs pa yang yongs su btang byas te 'bad pas te gus pa chen po bla ma dam pas byin pa'i lam bzang rin chen khyad par du 'phags pas legs par spa ba rab tu gsal ba ma yin par slob ma rnams kyis bya'o zhes pa
translated: Having given up doubt and so forth, one should, with effort, that is, with great respect, make the path given by the excellent guru, the excellent jewel, very clear, not unclear.

original: thar pa 'dod pa rnams kyis sam rin po che yongs su bsrung ba gsungs so zhes so ;
analyzed: thar pa 'dod pa rnams kyis sam rin po che yongs su bsrung ba gsungs so zhes so ;
translated: This is said for those who desire liberation, or for those who guard the jewel.

original: /'o na thar pa'i ched du lam gzhan yang yod pa ma yin nam nges na 'di la gus pas ci zhe na /
analyzed: /'o na thar pa'i ched du lam gzhan yang yod pa ma yin nam nges na 'di la gus pas ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, if there are other paths for the sake of liberation, why is there respect for this one?

original: gsungs pa dpa' bo zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa dpa' bo zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is said:

original: dpa' bo'i rim pa ni phyi rol gyi drag po'i lha mchod pa dang dmigs pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: dpa' bo'i rim pa ni phyi rol gyi drag po'i lha mchod pa dang dmigs pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: The stage of the hero is characterized by the worship of the external fierce deities, visualization, and so forth.

original: rang byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa ni sems kyis zhi ba'i rnal 'byor gyi sgo la dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: rang byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa ni sems kyis zhi ba'i rnal 'byor gyi sgo la dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: The stage of self-consecration is the characteristic of the meditative object of the yoga of mental peace.

original: thar ba'i ched du sangs rgyas rnams kyis yang dag par bstan pa min zhes pa'o //
analyzed: thar ba'i ched du sangs rgyas rnams kyis yang dag par bstan pa min zhes pa'o //
translated: The Buddhas have not taught it for the sake of liberation.

original: bstan pa 'di ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: bstan pa 'di ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is this teaching?üîΩIt is said:

original: gsungs pa / shin tu rnam dag rim pa gcig tu'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa / shin tu rnam dag rim pa gcig tu'o //
translated: The stage of complete purity is one.

original: zhes pa ste rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ste rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor gnyis su med pa'o //
translated: The yoga of the perfection stage is nondual.üîΩIf it is asked how this is to be known, it is said:

original: gal te 'di lta bu ji ltar shes par bya zhe na gsungs pa bde ba nyid kyi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te 'di lta bu ji ltar shes par bya zhe na gsungs pa bde ba nyid kyi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: By the bliss itself, and so on.

original: rgyu gang zhig gis rgyal ba'i dbang po rnams kyi mtshams med lnga po byed pa rnams yang dag par bzung ba ste dbugs phyung bar gyur @58a * //
analyzed: rgyu gang zhig gis rgyal ba'i dbang po rnams kyi mtshams med lnga po byed pa rnams yang dag par bzung ba ste dbugs phyung bar gyur @58a * //
translated: By what cause are the lords of the victorious ones, the perpetrators of the five inexpiable acts, truly taken, that is, comforted?

original: pa'o ; / mtshams med lnga po rnams ni //
analyzed: pa'o ; / mtshams med lnga po rnams ni //
translated: The five inexpiable acts are

original: ma gsod pa dang / pha gsod pa dang / dgra bcom pa gsod pa dang / dge 'dun 'byed pa dang / ngan sems kyis de bzhin gshegs pa la khrag 'byin pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ma gsod pa dang / pha gsod pa dang / dgra bcom pa gsod pa dang / dge 'dun 'byed pa dang / ngan sems kyis de bzhin gshegs pa la khrag 'byin pa zhes pa'o //
translated: killing one's mother, killing one's father, killing an arhat, causing a schism in the community, and maliciously drawing blood from a Tathagata.

original: lnga po rnams kyis gang yang rung ba'i skyon gyis bar mtshams med pa kho nar mnar med par bskal par gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lnga po rnams kyis gang yang rung ba'i skyon gyis bar mtshams med pa kho nar mnar med par bskal par gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: By means of any one of the five, one will remain in the Avici hell for an eon, and there will be no interval.

original: des na mtshams med par brjod do //
analyzed: des na mtshams med par brjod do //
translated: Therefore, they are called uninterrupted.

original: bde ba nyid kyis te thabs bde bas so //
analyzed: bde ba nyid kyis te thabs bde bas so //
translated: By means of bliss, that is, by means of the bliss of the means.

original: dbang don gyis te bzhi pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: dbang don gyis te bzhi pa'i don gyis so //
translated: By means of the meaning of the fourth, that is, by means of the meaning of the fourth consecration.

original: gzhan du na mtshams med pa lnga po byed pa rnams dpa' bo'i rim pa drag po'i las kyis zil gyis mnan pa rnams dang / rang byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa 'khor ba'i bde ba shin tu 'phel ba'i bag chags kyi rgyud rnams kyis thar ba thob pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du na mtshams med pa lnga po byed pa rnams dpa' bo'i rim pa drag po'i las kyis zil gyis mnan pa rnams dang / rang byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa 'khor ba'i bde ba shin tu 'phel ba'i bag chags kyi rgyud rnams kyis thar ba thob pa ma yin te /
translated: Otherwise, those who commit the five heinous acts, who are overcome by the fierce actions of the hero's stage, and whose continuums are the cause of the habitual tendencies of the great increase of the bliss of cyclic existence by means of the stage of self-consecration, do not attain liberation.

original: rgyud des zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rgyud des zhes pa'o //
translated: By means of that continuum, that is, by means of the continuum of the five heinous acts.

original: 'o na gal te rim pa gnyis po 'di rim pa ma yin par khyed sems na de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis ci'i don du gsungs she na gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'o na gal te rim pa gnyis po 'di rim pa ma yin par khyed sems na de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis ci'i don du gsungs she na gsungs pa /
translated: He says:

original: dpa' bo zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The hero does not have a stage outside.

original: hi ste gang gi phyir lus srog zad pa 'di gsungs pa de'i phyir dpa' bo rim pa phyi rol la min no //
analyzed: hi ste gang gi phyir lus srog zad pa 'di gsungs pa de'i phyir dpa' bo rim pa phyi rol la min no //
translated: Since he taught this exhaustion of body and life, therefore the hero does not have a stage outside.

original: 'o na de ltar lus la rang byin gyis brlab pa gsal lam zhe na gang gi phyir rang gi sems byin gyis brlab pa so sor snang ba ste /
analyzed: 'o na de ltar lus la rang byin gyis brlab pa gsal lam zhe na gang gi phyir rang gi sems byin gyis brlab pa so sor snang ba ste /
translated: Now, is the body thus self-consecration clear? Since self-consecration is the appearance of one's mind,

original: de yang stong pa la khams gsum pa nyid mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de yang stong pa la khams gsum pa nyid mthong ba'o //
translated: and that is the seeing of the three realms in emptiness.

original: mtshan zhes pa rab tu grags pa'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan zhes pa rab tu grags pa'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Signs are well known.

original: 'gro ba'i don byed pa rnams kyi shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rim pa rnam par gzhag pa yang gsungs so zhes pa'o ;
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don byed pa rnams kyi shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rim pa rnam par gzhag pa yang gsungs so zhes pa'o ;
translated: He also taught the arrangement of the stage of complete purification for those who work for the welfare of the world.
